intro: Sessea brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian sesseae, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Sessea brasiliensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
